code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:a white M aged 38 yrs presents with moderate nausea, moderate abdominal pain and Stomach. o:Height 169 cm, Weight 52.3 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 14, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed prochlorperazine - 25 mg daily (rectal dose), and ordered CT Abdomen.

s:pt presents with moderate abdominal pain. patient also reports moderate nausea. patient is a white male investment banker aged 40 years. o:Height 170 cm, Weight 53 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to gastroenterology.

s:a 40 yr old white M presents with progressive moderate nausea and moderate abdominal pain for past 5 days. describes drinking an average of 12 beers a week for about 5 years in his past he states he has never smoked a cigarette in his life o:Height 170 cm, Weight 53.2 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered CT Abdomen.

content2.Unmatched: his past he states he has
